Open thread • Replies: 29 • Updated: 2026-02-22 20:01 UTC

OP

How's FIRE going for you, anons?

61884964
>>61884958
Well I'm looking into LCOL countries I can retire to because waiting until I'm a multi millionaire in the states is not viable.

61884966
>>61884958
Just need a 7x then I'm good. Already have rope if ready if I don't reach the goal in 5 years

61884967
>>61884958
i have about 3m networth but haven't quit my job yet. making too much money but want to quit real bad. i took a 4 day weekend recently and got bored because i have no life and hobbies because my job dominates my life and i have no energy left over to develop my personal life after work.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61884968
>>61884958
>LCOL countries
What are the options these days?

61884974
>>61884968
Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, Albania, is what I got so far.
Maybe Japan or Italy.

61884976
>>61884958
About $30MM now, I'm 38. Feels good.

61884979
>>61884967
They've done an excellent job of trapping you, anon.

61884983
>>61884958
I'm back to ramen noodle mode.
I WILL make this savings last until I get a job again.

61884986
>>61884958
I'm just living off NEETbux+savings. It doesn't completely cover rent, so once my savings are gone I'm going to just KYS myself.

61884996
>>61884974
Interesting. I never thought of Japan as having a low cost of living. And I've heard Thailand is not as cheap as it was.

61884999
>>61884976
>>61884986
I listened to a Grant Cardone video on YouTube about pulling IRA retirement money into self-directed fund then you can use it to buy real estate without getting the penalty but you have to go big and do multi-dwelling unit or else IRS flags you. I'm too chicken shit to try it (yet) but if you're going to an hero anyway fuck it try it
>pull life retirement savings
>buy 10 unit apartment building
>give self job fixing toilets
>collect rent from tenants
>profit

61885003
ok maybe a 3 unit building

61885030
>>61884999
You literally cannot fix the toilets yourself. Under IRC §4975 you are considered a "disqualified" person. Basically you can own it but you can never touch it. Very gay way to 'own' something.

61885054
way ahead of schedule.
>Full time job income (104K + 11K in retirement)
>Cost of living 32K
>Fully owned apartment(450K)
>308K in liquidish assets
>90K in retirement
>2K coming in every month from passive revenue from a side business (vidya gaems)
In 7-8 years i will probably reach full FIRE. But i'm releasing new products this year. If i can have similar success i will probably just Barista FIRE living the gamedev dream.

61885059
>>61884967
Dude, just quit. You'll probably decompress after a month or two, then you can re-evaluate. If you decide you need to work, then you can just go apply to some jobs. Maybe you'll decide you want to work in a library or something stupid like that.

61885062
>>61885030
that fucking sucks what is Cardone talking about then?
retirement money is just going to the bank then when I starve to death. maybe that was their plan all along.
take the 10% penalty + taxes ? now it's a duplex maybe in a cold flyover state

61885102
Just had my 2nd kid.
Already gave up and accepted that I'll be waging til I die.

61885131
>>61884958
Pretty good despite the recent market drawdown. I stopped working 9 months ago and moved to a luxury condo in Thailand. Expenses are relatively low but I'm still paying my mortgage and car note in America. I get a little bit of income from trading options and renting out my house to my younger sister. I'm financially set for the rest of my life but I'm still figuring out what I want to do as far as family, kids, etc.

61885135
>>61885062
>>61885030
>>61884986

ok I found this. instead of self directed IRA to have to roll it into a business startup
so don't an hero yet
or put me down as your beneficiary first

https://www.bankrate.com/loans/small-business/what-are-robs/#:~:text=Key%20takeaways,penalties%20are%20associated%20with%20ROBS.

61885141
>>61884967
Nigger. Based on the 4% rule you can draw about 120k yearly off investments and statistically never run out of money. Wife and I retired early w/ Lite Fire. No debt. Last year our gross income was $55,000. We bought and sold a RV, Saw the Grand Canyon, Zion, Bryce Canyon, Rushmore. Took a 21 day cruise from west coast through Panama Canal, Cruised out of Florida for 3 weeks and hung out in Fort Lauderdale for 2. Did 2 more week in the Caribbean. Have a 20 day transatlantic cruise from NYC to Sicily booked with stops in 9 ports in April. Tons of midweek short trips seeing cool shit. Leaving work is an adjustment definitely but I have never been happier. See the world, meet people, always with an eye to relocation. Picrel is heading into Cartagena Columbia.

61885152
>>61884967
I was just like you before I decided to walk away. I call it "golden handcuffs" when a job pays so well that it makes you feel obligated to keep going even though you don't need the money. Your job feels like your identity but I promise you'll forget about it after you quit and find new hobbies and a gf.

61887260
>>61884974
>>61884996
Japan is not a lcol area. Its cheaper compared to the west but not Thailand/Vietnam cheap. My plan is to live 90 days visa free there a year and live frugally elsewhere for the rest of the year.

61887270
>>61884958
Closing in on luxury fat FIRE thanks to gold/silver/oil/uranium. Fuck crypto.

61887292
I don't want to retire early, cuz id probably just be doing the same thing without getting paid for it, but i have enough money to be comfortable for now

61887302
I am starting to realize the whole game plan of FIRE is just giving me reason to wake up in the morning, something to look forward to. I dont think I will really be that much happier once I achieve my dream of semi financial freedom.

61887313
>>61887292
>id probably just be doing the same thing without getting paid for it
Your job is your hobby? Congrats. What do you do?

61887338
It's not really going.
Would take me getting my inheritance and buying the bottom of the next global market crash and riding the recovery wave with everything I can throw in during it.

61887601
uhh im 38. been retired since 32. probably unretiring soon.

61887625
>>61887313
gay prostitute

>Such a weird term clearly carrying different meaning. What is the point of using a term that literally has no definition to its meaning
It's just people overusing words or ideas to oblivion, where they lose all context. It's like the worst insult was being called gay way back, then it was subverted (actually gay is cool), then it became retarded, then it got subverted (actually retarded is cool because you're not trying), then it become autistic, then it became subverted (actually it's interesting to be autistic), now it's random baby talk by gen alpha (mog, cortisol spike, chopped, unc, lil bro, frame, aura farming, 67, incel, cuk). Now it's being subverted by people overusing the terms even if they don't apply to anyone or anything in the context at all. Someone not having sex for a week = incel. Someone having a slightly embarrassing moment (cortisol spike), someone better looking walking past (mogged), doing something that's barely good (aura farming), having a strong presence even if it's completely autistic and retarded (frame). Or like when old people started wearing skateboard shirts having no clue what it was, or everyone and their dog wearing an off white shirt. People make shit gay eventually, it's a universal law.

item.title: Is it even possible to make it by opening a traditional business anymore? — 26 replies — 15.8/hr
item.content:encoded:
Is it even possible to make it by opening a traditional business anymore?

Open thread • Replies: 26 • Updated: 2026-02-22 19:07 UTC

OP

Read subject

Is it even possible? Not only do you have to jump through a million regulations and fees just to get started, you're also competing against trillion dollar mega corps who can and will undercut you because they employ ten thousand indians and illegals who work for pennies. Even traditional blue collar jobs like plumbers and HVAC are all slowly coagulating into one single corporate entity (in my area), and basically every single mom and pop store was killed during COVID.

It seems like the only way you can actually achieve anything is to basically trick angle investors into giving your bullshit tech start-up a ton of money or getting really lucky and have an app you make be bought out by a megacorp so they can rape your customers to death.

Pic unrelated

Early replies (first 3)

61881446
>>61881439
Step 1: get a girlfriend
Step 2: have her start an ASMR channel on YouTube
Step 3: have her start a merchandise line on shopify
There.

61881567
>>61881446
the pretty girl ASMR youtuber to OF is so undefeated.. Ive been watching ASMR for 8 years and the amount of hot ASMR girls that build a quick following and launch OF is high.

61881609
>>61881446
>Step 1: get a girlfriend
Do you have anything more realistic that I can accomplish?

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61881624
>>61881609
Become a trans vtuber. Work on your feminine voice.

61882459
>>61881439
Even trillion dollar companies can't do everything. The amount of bureaucracy involved to manage such a large entity is limiting in its own ways.
You have to find a niche that isn't currently being served in your market and then create a business for that.
For example: nobody is making catgirl gfs right now, it's a completely untapped market.

61882478
Corporations can now grow indefinetly due to advancement's in economic planning. It used to be theyd crash and burn after they got to a certain size.

61882584

This, also after few years of HRT start OF, get cosmetic surgeries to look like a bimbo

61882649

61883247
>>61881439
It's possible, but made very difficult by design. Can't have too many people escaping the wage cage.

Everything is over regulated, because it means only mega corps have the resources to deal with the BS.

but you're right about consolidation and private equity ownership. there's no way around this, other than killing PE jews or the people who sell out to PE.

* sue the shit out of anyone who infringes
* make outsized profits on everything you sell

I vaguely remember being told by one of my patent law professors during law school that over 80% of profits in the U.S. are tied to intellectual property, i.e., patents and copyrights. Commodity goods just aren't profitable when you have to compete by selling as close to zero margin as you can get, and make it up on volume.

A company called Rare Breed is doing that right now in the field of "forced reset trigger systems" for firearms. Their projections are that they will make mid-eight figures of profit annually if they are the sole source. Note "profit" not "revenue". Manufacturing costs on each of their units is probably around $50, and they're selling them for $500 each.

The difficulty: lots of infringers, including one batshit insane asshole from Arizona, and one kid who designed a free one that anyone can 3D print at home. (And in all fairness, the kid put it out on free 3D printing websites before several of Rare Breed's patents issued, but after they were filed, so he arguably wasn't even infringing at the time.) They've got something like seventeen lawsuits going right now, IIRC, and some of the defendants are trying to get their cases consolidated into a single trial because of the expense.

61884359
It's like getting into the in-game market in an MMO that's been around for 20 years, it's completely futile

61884385
>>61881624
>>61882584
picrelated

61884627
Of course it is. Where do you think all these giant houses come from? There's tons of well-off business owners all throughout your city, state, country.

61886156
>>61884627
Most of whom got started a couple of generations ago. Then they set up legislative roadblocks to make it impossible for new competitors to spring up.

My state requires a 1000 hour training certificate before someone can cut hair. As a result, a large percentage of those who do it are guys who were stuck in prison and learned their trade in the prison barbershop, because it was free for them.

61886164
>>61884627
Oh, I forgot about the used car lots. Used to be that anyone could set up as a used car dealer. Then the big stealerships started getting outcompeted, with one big driver (heh) being because the independents would stay open on Sundays while the stealerships were closed. So the stealerships lobbied the legislature to prohibit used car lots from being open on Sundays.

Lots more similar stories in various businesses. Funeral parlors are heavily regulated (the excuse being "they can dispose of bodies in their crematoriums, so we have to regulate and license that profession"), and so on and so on.

FFS in NYC Mamdani just asked for "volunteer snow shovelers" and demanded that they register with """""""""""The City""""""' by showing two forms of ID plus their Social Security card.

61886443
>>61886156
Reminds me of this
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ouP2qhTF3x4
In Oklahoma you need a funeral director's license to sell coffins
>In order to become a licensed funeral director in Oklahoma, an individual must have a high school diploma or GED, complete a minimum two-year accredited mortuary science program, and pass the National Board Exam and the Oklahoma State Board of Mortuary Arts Exam. After completing the educational requirements, the individual must also complete a one-year apprenticeship in an Oklahoma funeral home.
All that just to sell a box.

61886977
>>61884346
Lol. No. It does not work like that. Only companies with in house lawyers benefit from patents, and they are mostly defensive.

61887004
>>61881439

The path easiest for good money with least effort is to become a corporate drone. You gotta learn to speak the lingo and be agreeable and subservient. This is why they want a college degree.
Watch the movie "office space" for a comedic and yet canny take on corporate life. Its easy boring shit, but just like in the movie you will find yourself dreaming about working on a road crew or something.

yeah but you have to understand the end game. its not to run a business, it's to build a profitable business to sell to private equity. build a business doing plumbing hvac whatever, get reliable cashflow, get customers, sell it. rinse and repeat. one of my good friends does this with hvac, finds an under served area, spend 2-3 years building it and sell off to a mega corp. easily in the 8 figure club in his 40s

What is your current occupation anon? I did some modeling around warrant prices if the shares price goes to xyz and that is very interesting...also speaking of interesting what's the deal with the alleged cusip similarity to the old bbbyq shares?

61880091

Financial system. I am not asking you to hold those warrants until they are exercised. I am asking you to hold them and sell the warrants when we can realize a substantial profit. Nice quads.

61881477
>>61880091
Interesting. Wouldn't trading the warrants implicitly come with a short term capital gains tax insofar as its impossible to hold them over a year at this point? Would have to be some pretty fair gains to offset that 40% hit...anyways doesn't the warrants increasing in price also imply that the shares have gone up in price as well? I ran some informal modeling estimates using black scholes with iv, roughly .65 years to expiry and this is what I came up with: 15.5 bbby share price = 4.50ish warrant price...25 share price/12ish warrant price...60 share price/45ish warrant price...100 share price/85ish warrant price...200 share price 185ish warrant price...I make no claim as to the veracity of these numbers, just for fun. Anyways what do you see happening to the bbby stock price for these warrants to be worthwhile? Am I thinking on the right track in general?
